Sarah Lam is a British-Chinese actress, noted for her UK television roles.
She played Susannah in the sitcom No Problem!, Linda Mo in Angels, Anna Lee in Howards' Way and Caroline Choi in Brookside.
Other TV credits include: Two Thousand Acres of Sky, Q.E.D., The Chinese Detective, C.A.T.S. Eyes, A Very Peculiar Practice, The Adventure Game, To Be the Best, Virtual Murder, Sherlock, Inspector Morse, The Bill and Holby City.
Sarah Lam has recently been involved in the production The World of Extreme Happiness at the National Theatre.In 2015 she appeared on TV again, in Casualty on BBC1 (series 29, episode 33:  "Against The Odds"). She also appeared in The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole as a nurse and the 80s cult show The Adventure Game.
Sarah is due to appear in Paradise, Kae Tempest's new all-female version of Sophocles' play Philoctetes, opening in the Olivier Theatre at the National Theatre in August 2021. Postponed from 2020, it is to be directed by Ian Rickson with Lesley Sharp as the title character.

response: In May 1989, a young professional Chinese family, the Chois, arrived at vacated number 7. Widower Michael (David Yip) moved in with his young daughter Jessica and before long, he embarked on a relationship with a colleague, scientist Alison Gregory (Alyson Spiro). Michael's sister Caroline (Sarah Lam) also moved in, providing storylines for the increasingly popular Sinbad, who was attracted to her. Sinbad had gradually risen from the ranks of occasional comic-relief character to a popular member of the cast, and his part continued to grow. He was eventually reunited with his estranged mother Ruth (Mary Healey), before finding love with Marcia Barrett (Cheryl Maiker) to whom he was briefly engaged.Brookside. The First 10 Years.
